result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Pre-trial conference on June 23, 2022 at 10:15 am.

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release.  
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with Janice R. except for the purposes of child exchanges.
  - Defendant shall not consume or possess alcohol.  
- Defendant shall not be on N. Sherman Ave. except for the purposes of child exchanges.
  Defendant has acknowledged and agreed to terms and conditions of bond. Defendant must return signed bond form within 10 days of today. Any bail money previously posted will not be returned until a signed bond form is on file with the Clerk of Courts.
  Trial Judge - Br 17

09:47 AM Defendant appeared.  Lillian Rose Nelson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  All parties by Zoom. The defendant was advised regarding their right to an attorney and to the SPD application process if not already represented. Defendant DID NOT receive a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts. COURT TO MAIL COPY OF COMPLAINT TO DEFENDANT.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 23, 2022 at 10:15 am.
